intro: Codia belepensis, commonly known as the Bismarck Islands codia, is a flowering plant native to the Bismarck Archipelago in Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. Its leaves are ovate and often covered in a fine, silky hair, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Codia belepensis is adapted to coastal environments and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils.
